intro: Pituranthos chloranthus subsp. intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate chloranthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, disc-like clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
